Posts.Content: Thank you for your response. That is what I am hoping for. I have looked at some of your postings and you seem very medically savvy. Again, thank you for your response.
Posts.Title: architectural distortion

Posts.Content: I just had a mammogram and it came back with architectural distortion in the right breast. My doctor says not to worry, but go for a repeat mammogram. The nurses in the office said the report did not sound concerning too, and one receptionist had this and it was the result of the mammogram having the distortion not the breast! I am so scared as reading on the internet does say that architectural distortion can be a sign of breast cancer. Has anyone had this show up on a mammogram? Can anyone offer some encouragement or experience with this? Really scared! Thank you
Posts.Title: architectural distortion

Posts.Content: I am going through the same awful weekend as i didn't find out until Friday also. So glad everything was fine with your friend. Hoping to get in somewhere tomorrow and getting good news.
Posts.Title: architectural distortion

Posts.Content: Don't ever feel silly about posting. It helps to share and get out our nervous feelings and being nervous is certainly fine and normal. Please let me know what you find out. Good thoughts are with you.
Posts.Title: Scared awaiting Biopsy

Posts.Content: Being that no one has answered us, I just wanted to say that I am thinking of you and hoping that everything turns out just fine. Keep holding on. It will be OK.

Posts.Content: Great news. Very happy for you. I have had a good outcome as well. Go enjoy your summer and your son.
